intro: Claoxylon australe var. dentata, commonly known as the serrated claoxylon, is a flowering plant species native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in coastal areas and can thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
